content:
Imagine you are a robot browsing the web, just like humans. Now you need to complete a task. In each iteration, you will receive an Observation that includes a screenshot of a webpage and some texts. This screenshot will feature Numerical Labels placed in the TOP LEFT corner of each Web Element.
Carefully analyze the visual information to identify the Numerical Label corresponding to the Web Element that requires interaction, then follow the guidelines and choose one of the following actions:
1. Click a Web Element.
2. Delete existing content in a textbox and then type content. 
3. Scroll up or down. Multiple scrolls are allowed to browse the webpage. Pay attention!! The default scroll is the whole window. If the scroll widget is located in a certain area of the webpage, then you have to specify a Web Element in that area. I would hover the mouse there and then scroll.
4. Wait. Typically used to wait for unfinished webpage processes, with a duration of 5 seconds.
5. Go back, returning to the previous webpage.
6. Google, directly jump to the Google search page. When you can't find information in some websites, try starting over with Google.
7. Answer. This action should only be chosen when all questions in the task have been solved.

Correspondingly, Action should STRICTLY follow the format:
- Click [Numerical_Label]
- Type [Numerical_Label]; [Content]
- Scroll [Numerical_Label or WINDOW]; [up or down]
- Wait
- GoBack
- Google
- ANSWER; [content]

Key Guidelines You MUST follow:
* Action guidelines *
1) To input text, NO need to click textbox first, directly type content. After typing, the system automatically hits `ENTER` key. Sometimes you should click the search button to apply search filters. Try to use simple language when searching.  
2) You must Distinguish between textbox and search button, don't type content into the button! If no textbox is found, you may need to click the search button first before the textbox is displayed. 
3) Execute only one action per iteration. 
4) STRICTLY Avoid repeating the same action if the webpage remains unchanged. You may have selected the wrong web element or numerical label. Continuous use of the Wait is also NOT allowed.
5) When a complex Task involves multiple questions or steps, select "ANSWER" only at the very end, after addressing all of these questions (steps). Flexibly combine your own abilities with the information in the web page. Double check the formatting requirements in the task when ANSWER. 
* Web Browsing Guidelines *
1) Don't interact with useless web elements like Login, Sign-in, donation that appear in Webpages. Pay attention to Key Web Elements like search textbox and menu.
2) Vsit video websites like YouTube is allowed BUT you can't play videos. Clicking to download PDF is allowed and will be analyzed by the Assistant API.
3) Focus on the numerical labels in the TOP LEFT corner of each rectangle (element). Ensure you don't mix them up with other numbers (e.g. Calendar) on the page.
4) Focus on the date in task, you must look for results that match the date. It may be necessary to find the correct year, month and day at calendar.
5) Pay attention to the filter and sort functions on the page, which, combined with scroll, can help you solve conditions like 'highest', 'cheapest', 'lowest', 'earliest', etc. Try your best to find the answer that best fits the task.

Your reply should strictly follow the format:
Thought: {Your brief thoughts (briefly summarize the info that will help ANSWER)}
Action: {One Action format you choose}
Confidence: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating your confidence level in the action. A higher value means greater confidence.}
Completion: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating how much of the task has been completed until now. Zero means no progress has been made and one means full completion.}

Then the User will provide:
Observation: {A labeled screenshot Given by User}

Now given a task: Check the Apple Store for the availability of the latest iPhone model and schedule an in-store pickup at the nearest Apple Store for January 10, 2024.  Please interact with https://www.apple.com/ and get the answer.Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The page is set to Canada (English) with a prompt at the top to "Continue." The latest iPhone model is prominently displayed as "iPhone 17 Pro." To check availability and schedule in-store pickup, I should proceed to the iPhone section.
Action: Click [6]
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.15
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The iPhone 17 Pro is the latest model and is available for pre-order. To check its availability and proceed with in-store pickup scheduling, I should select the "iPhone 17 Pro" option.
Action: Click [17]
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.25
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The page shows a large iPhone 17 Pro image, likely a product landing/intro page. To check availability and proceed to scheduling in-store pickup, I need to look for purchasing options or scroll down for the product purchase or customization section.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.3
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The "Pre-order" button for the iPhone 17 Pro is visible. To check availability for in-store pickup and scheduling, the next step is to proceed with the pre-order process.
Action: Click [0]
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.4
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: This screen provides a pre-order summary and model options, but no direct prompts for pickup options or location selection are present yet. To move closer to scheduling an in-store pickup, scrolling further may reveal the purchase process with pickup options.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.45
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The "Pick up from Store" option is visible at the top right, which is likely to lead to in-store pickup scheduling. Selecting this is necessary to check pickup availability and proceed to choosing a date/store.
Action: Click [5]
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.55
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The page is prompting for configuration (choosing the iPhone 17 Pro and selecting a color). I need to continue the selection process to proceed to details like pickup date/location. The next step is to select a color.
Action: Click [18]
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.6
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The color "Silver" has been selected for the iPhone 17 Pro. To continue the configuration and reach pickup scheduling, I should look for storage or spec options or proceed further down the purchasing flow.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.65
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The storage configuration options for the iPhone 17 Pro are now shown. Selecting a storage option is required to proceed to pickup scheduling. The base option (256GB) is likely adequate for the demo.
Action: Click [1]
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.7
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The 256GB storage option is now selected. Next, I should scroll down to continue with the purchasing configuration and move towards scheduling an in-store pickup.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.75
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The next step is to clarify trade-in options. Since the main goal is to check availability and schedule in-store pickup, selecting "No trade-in" will be the quickest route to proceed.
Action: Click [5]
Confidence: 0.99
Completion: 0.8
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: "No trade-in" is selected and there is confirmation. The next likely step is further configuration for purchase or pickup, so I should scroll down to access the next section (likely regarding pickup options).
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.85
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The purchase flow is now at the payment options step. To proceed smoothly and reach pickup scheduling, selecting the straightforward "Buy" option should advance us toward the pickup options.
Action: Click [1]
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.88
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The "Buy" payment option is now selected. The next step is to choose a carrier, which is required before proceeding to pickup scheduling. AT&T is a common choice and selecting any carrier should progress the flow.
Action: Click [10]
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.9
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Both the payment and carrier options are now selected. The "Pick up from Store" option at the top right will likely allow scheduling an in-store pickup and checking date availability.
Action: Click [1]
Confidence: 0.99
Completion: 0.93
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The interface has not changed after the previous click, and the "Pick up from Store" element (top right) appears not to be interactive based on the lack of change. To proceed, I should scroll down to see if scheduling options (date/store selection) are presented further below in the purchasing process.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.97
Completion: 0.94
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The section now presents AppleCare coverage options. To proceed toward store pickup date/location selection, the AppleCare (or "No AppleCare") choice must be made first.
Action: Click [6]
Confidence: 0.99
Completion: 0.95
